text: Charles Armstrong may refer to: *Charles Armstrong (ethnographer) (born 1971), British ethnographer and technologist *Charles Armstrong (rower) (1881–1952), American rower who won a medal at the 1904 Summer Olympics *Charles Armstrong (physician) (1886–1967), American physician in the U.S. Public Health Service * Charles Armstrong (soldier) (1897–1985), British military officer *Charles Armstrong (baseball) (1914–1990), American professional baseball player and football coach *Charles Armstrong (politician), member of the Arkansas House of Representatives *Charles Armstrong School, California *Charles Armstrong- Jones (born 1999), son of the 2nd Earl and Countess of Snowdon and great- grandson of King George VI of the United Kingdom *Charles Armstrong (Northern Ireland), man who disappeared in 1981, suspected to be a victim of the Provisional IRA *Chuck Armstrong, president of the Seattle Mariners Major League Baseball club *Charles K. Armstrong (born 1962), professor of Korean Studies at Columbia University involved in a plagiarism and falsification controversy *Charlie Armstrong (musician), jazz musician and songwriter *Charles L. Armstrong (1944–2011), United States Marine Corps officer *Charlie Armstrong (footballer) (1883–1954), Australian rules footballer *Charles F. Armstrong (North Carolina politician) (1919-1965), American lawyer and politician *Charles F. Armstrong (Pennsylvania politician) (c. 1866-1934), American politician *Charlie Armstrong (American football) (1923–2002), American football halfback and fullback
title: Charles Armstrong
